sectionList.description: Sliced pears, spinach, spring mix, red onion, dried cranberry, goat cheese & brown sugar bourbon
Think picnic!, Eggs filled with a whipped mixture of mustard, mayo, dill & cayenne, topped with bacon and a sliver of chive.
Well, we don’t make the chips, but we do everything else! Chips covered with a bed of homemade chili, lettuce, cheese and peppers.

These have got to be the best pretzels in town. Made specially for us by local Tuba Baking using a 200 year old German recipe. 6 individual pretzel balls served with Northern Row’s house made beer cheese and stone ground mustard!
Cincinnati is the mecca of chili, so here is our tribute to the hard working steam table chefs of the city.
Bacon, quartered tomatoes, shredded cheddar, and ranch tossed with our house greens.
Sliced golden beets, spinach, spring mix, red onion, dried cranberry, goat cheese & brown sugar bourbon walnuts. Served with a side of sweet balsamic.
Northern Row chicken salad served on a bed of fresh lettuce with cranberry's, diced celery, red pepper, and red onion.
Chicken breast, celery, red onion, dried cranberry, Northern Row mayo-sweet vinegar dressing, served on a warm Em’s sourdough bun with choice of side.

Shaved Allen Brothers roast beef, stout-caramelized onions, tangy cabbage slaw and house beer cheese served on slider buns specifically made for us by our friends at Em’s Bakery. Served with side of hot slaw.

We started with Pickled Pig caraway kraut and built this classic sandwich from there. Oven-roasted turkey, swiss, applewood bacon and house-made Thousand Island dressing, served on Allez Bakery rye with a choice of a side.
“The squeaky wheel gets the Reuben” Hope this keeps the olde guy happy! He likes to constantly remind us that a real reuben samich has Pastrami and a side. Made with amazing Allen Brothers pastrami.
Shaved Nueskie ham, melted Swiss, house made sweet pickles, classic yellow mustard, piled on an Em’s bun. What could be better?

We cut an Em’s Bun like a Big Mac then built this marvel. Ham & Swiss on the bottom, and a Turkey, Roast Beef, bacon, lettuce, and Northern Row Peppery Mustard Mayo on top. This beast is worthy of a story! Comes with a side.
Slow cooked beef, seasoned and pulled and served with horseradish sauce between a potato bun. Comes with choice of side.
Big enough to share: seven layers of refried beans, house-made chili, sour cream, shredded lettuce, shredded cheese, salsa and guacamole, surrounded by chips. Serves 4.
Rotini noodles covered with our Chicken Pot Pie mix. This employee favorite has been voted our grab and go to food item.
Tender roasted acorn squash, stuffed with rice, green onion, garlic, cranberry, & parlsey salad. Topped with grated parmesan & pepitas.
Outcast Gargantuan twist on a hometown favorite. We promise you won’t leave hungry!
A classic comfort dish. House made using our own Hustler beer cheese. Elbow noodles, Gruyere cheese topped with Grippo’s barbecue crumbles.
Tender shredded chicken breast, house-made gravy with vegetables. Topped with a buttery crust.
Bowtie pasta, broccoli, red onion, red bell peppers, distillery- slaw dressing.
We avoided the obvious pun because Francois the beer weasel takes his popcorn seriously.
Cross Vine Street and try this treat from our West Side’s German heritage! Name says it all.
Russet potatoes, celery, green onion, boiled egg, mustard, brewery-blended mayo-honey dressing.
House greens, shredded cheddar, red onion, croutons, and a side of ranch dressing.

sectionList.header: HOLY TOLEDO IT'S A BREAKFAST BURRITO
sectionList.description:
Veggie burrito: Scrambled eggs, salsa con queso, seasoned potatoes, bell peppers, heirloom tomatoes, black beans. 
 Sausage burrito: scrambled eggs, salsa con queso, seasoned potatoes,bell peppers, LK Hand- made Sausage from Findlay Market.
Light, crisp, traditional German lager. “Like brewing in a Speedo: Nothing to hide behind!”
Light, bright, refreshing and subtly sweet. We use traditional Ingredients to pay homage to a classic style out of Cologne, Germany.
Traditional German wheat beer. Banana and clove esters.
German amber lager, nutty, toasty and caramelly Festbier. malt character.
German amber lager, nutty, toasty and caramelly Festbier. malt character.
Super smooth malty IPA, highlighting locally grown fresh Hops from Boondock’s Hop Farm in New Richmond, Ohio.
Our Drifter IPA with a fresh addition of blood orange.
Our original house IPA. Rich and hoppy with a dry finish
Robust imperial stout aged for over a year in various bourbon barrels.
IBUs are a little higher but the chocolate and coffee notes still shine through and it’s for a good cause.
Your prayers have been answered, and the Preacher is back in the house! Golden ale with a fresh addition of peach and apricot puree.
Ladies and Gentlemen, Tiny Elvis is in the building!
A light yet flavorful wheat beer with orange peel and coriander spice bringing out citrus notes. The Robber doesn’t ask what’s in the bag, he just takes it because he knows he likes it!

We had our friends at Douds Orchard in Indiana pick early harvest apples for our house cider blend. It starts with white wine notes and a beautiful green apple tart finish. This is a great non-beer option!

This post-prohibition recipe is bourbon served over a muddled sugar cube, house-infused cherry and finished with an orange zest. Served on the rocks. This is a big drink from a small Bartender with lots of personality, just like Carlye!
No matter how you shake it, it’s our most popular cocktail. Five Stories rum, lime, mint, sugar and soda. Served on the rocks in a tall pilsner glass. Ask your server about our seasonal Preacherito!
This blend of whiskey, peach schnapps and cranberry juice is the perfect shot when you have nowhere to go!
Five Stories White Rum, Grapefruit, Cherry Liqueur, Lime & Simple. We could write a book about this cocktail.
Five Stories 7X Vodka, basil, fresh-muddled strawberries: this easy sipper is as sweet as it is refreshing!
This is a refreshing and sweet blend of grapefruit, Tequila and housemade simple syrup. Perfect for relaxing on the Patio!
This very bourbon-forward drink is not for the faint of heart. Bourbon, house-made sour mix, and squeeze of OJ. Served on the rocks.
Five Stories 7X Vodka, coffee liquor served chilled in our classic coupe.
This West Coast version of a margarita highlights the fresh squeezed juices and natural citrus flavors. Served on the rocks in a salt rimmed glass.
Five Stories Vodka, Triple Sec, Cranberry juice and touch of lemon served chilled in our classic coupe.
Five Stories 7X Vodka, lemon, Served chilled in a classic coupe, finished with a sugared lemon.
Five Stories gin, lime juice, and soda served on the rocks. Very refreshing.

Five Stories 7X Vodka, lime, House-made ginger syrup & topped with ginger beer. Perfect drink for relaxing in O-T-R.Five Stories 7X Vodka, lime, House-made ginger syrup & topped with ginger beer. Perfect drink for relaxing in O-T-R.
Light-bodied, Spanish white wine made from two indigenous grapes (60% Macabeo, 40% Airén).
Medium-bodied, Spanish red made from the Tempranillo grape (the varietal that is used in Rioja).
Bright, crisp wine from Chile with citrus fruit flavors.

sectionList.header: CARL EHRHARDT “BLANC DE NOIRS” PINOT NOIR
sectionList.description: An extremely unique white wine made in Germany. Actually made from Pinot Noir (a red grape) where the juice is removed from the skins immediately after pressing so as not to impart any color, this is a “white from black” grapes (Blanc de Noirs) expression.
A fresh, medium-bodied Chardonnay from the Burgundy region of France. Apple and stonefruit with bright acidity.
This wine hails from the Rhone region of France. Full-bodied and aromatic, it is a blend of several indigenous white grapes.

This DRY rose with wild strawberry and red cherry aromas. Made through gentle pressing and leaving the skins in contact for a short amount of time, so as to only extract a small amount of pigment for the finished wine.
Small production Pinot Noir from the famed Willamette Valley of Oregon.
This “super-Tuscan” is a red blend of Sangiovese (the red grape of Chianti), Cabernet Sauvignon, and Merlot.
Classic California Cab with blackberry and spice.
Delivers bright citrus on the palate subtle melon flavors with crisp clean finish
Watermelon and raspberry notes with zesty finish. Subtile minerality.
Medium-bodied red leads with cedar, vanilla and baking spice aroma. Good tannic balance.
Bright fruit aroma with subtle toasted oak. Fruity nose with black pepper and spice.
Caribbean forward rum - back blended with ex-bourbon barrel aged rum to evoke a sweet, complex & smooth finish.
Subtle, sweet flavors take your thoughts to a beach cabana. Fresh roasted coconut with our Black-strap molasses based rum, a match made in heaven.

Five Stories original take on the classic London Dry. Distilled in house and having no additional sweet- ening nor flavoring after distillation. Strong Juniper aroma and flavor with a long dry finish.
Traditional botanical blend of the big seven. Highlighting the spicy notes of coriander and licorice balanced with an earthy dry finish.

This unique Gin has been distilled using fresh wet hop cones from our freinds at Boondocks Hop Farm in New Richmond Ohio. Presenting a subtile hint of the hop oils combined with light juniper and licorice.
Late fall harvested Juniper and Peppermint tea. Opens with light licorice and cinnamon spiciness, and finishes with a cool mint burst.
Grain based small batch vodka, distilled seven times for a smooth, soft and creamy mouth-feel with a clean finish.

This vodka is made using 5 types of fresh peppers that are hand sliced and macerated for two weeks. We then run the wash throught the still, keeping much of the pepper flavor without all of the heat. Suprisingly smooth and perfect for a spicy cock-tail.
Handcrafted from Geor- gia Peaches creating a wonderful aromatic spirit that naturally brings the sweet peach to your nose with a soft creamy buttery finish.
